histogram.name: Histogram.BadConstructionArguments
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms that were found to have bad construction arguments. These would be DCHECK exceptions in debug builds but have simply been logged and corrected as best as possible rather than crash.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentSnapshotBrowser
histogram.summary: The amount of discrepancy found when examining a single histogram's data in the browser process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentSnapshotChildProcess
histogram.summary: The amount of discrepancy found when examining a single histogram's data in a child process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA.

histogram.name: Histogram.MismatchedConstructionArguments
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms that were found to have construction arguments different from a previous instantiation of the same name. Entries here have conflicting definitions and should be investigated. Data collected for the secondary definitions will be silently dropped.

histogram.name: Histogram.PendingProcessNotResponding
histogram.summary: When metrics services (UMA) ran an update, the number of child processes that did not respond, providing histogram updates, before the timeout.

histogram.name: Histogram.PermanentNameChanged
histogram.obsolete: No longer in the codebase as of 06/2021.
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms of which the external name storage was altered after the histogram was created.

histogram.name: Histogram.ReceivedProcessGroupCount
histogram.summary: When metrics services (UMA) ran an update, the number of times the process groups (renderer processes and plugin/gpu processes) did not respond, providing histogram updates, before the timeout.

histogram.name: Histogram.TooManyBuckets.1000
histogram.summary: The hash codes of histograms that were found to request more than 1000 buckets. These would be DCHECK exceptions in debug builds if the limit is lowered so are being logged before that change.

histogram.name: UMA.ActualLogUploadInterval
histogram.summary: The actual interval between log upload start and previous log upload finished within the same process. A value of 0 indicates there was no previous upload. Prior to M71, logging for this metric was broken.

histogram.name: UMA.AntiVirusMetricsProvider.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of the attempt to enumerate the installed AntiVirus on the machine. This is recorded once during metrics initialization.

histogram.name: UMA.CleanExitBeaconConsistency
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 07/2021 in favor of CleanExitBeaconConsistency2. Version 2 changes semantics in some of the buckets, to support measuring the frequency with which the Local State data is missing.
histogram.summary: Recorded when the CleanExitBeacon is constructed. Reports the combined state of distinct clean exit beacons stored in Local State and the Windows registry (or NSUserDefaults on iOS). They are normally expected to be identical.

histogram.name: UMA.CleanExitBeaconConsistency2
histogram.summary: Recorded when the CleanExitBeacon is constructed. Reports the combined state of distinct clean exit beacons stored in Local State and the Windows registry (or NSUserDefaults on iOS). They are normally expected to be identical. Updated from CleanExitBeaconConsistency to add missing values in local state.

histogram.name: UMA.ClientIdBackupRecoveredWithAge
histogram.summary: Recorded when we are somehow missing the client ID stored in Local State yet are able to recover it from a backup location along with the backed up installation date. This report carries the age in hours of the recovered client id.

histogram.name: UMA.ClientIdCleared
histogram.summary: Recorded when the client id is cleared due to the device opting out of UMA metrics.

histogram.name: UMA.ClientIdSource
histogram.summary: The source of the client id when its creation is forced.

histogram.name: UMA.DataValidation.LogNormal
histogram.summary: This is logged with a random value drawn from an artificial log normal distribution in every ongoing metrics logs (not logs about the previous session) and used for data validation. The mean and standard deviation parameters of the log normal distribution are controlled by artificial A/B experiments so that we can assess the accuracy and power of data from field trials.

histogram.name: UMA.EnrollmentStatus
histogram.summary: Logs the device enrollment status for Chrome OS device. Logged with every UMA upload.

histogram.name: UMA.EntropySourceType
histogram.summary: Logs the entropy source type that was used for field trial randomization. Logged once at each start up.

histogram.name: UMA.ExternalExperiment.GroupCount
histogram.summary: Logged on Android whenever an external experiment is registered. The logged value is the number of groups in the experiment. This will not be logged at all if there are no external experiments, but will be logged on group transitions (e.g. when going from 1 to 0 groups).

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.AccessResult
histogram.summary: Records attempts to access a file for the purpose of extracting metrics.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialAccessResult
histogram.summary: Records attempts to access a file for the purpose of extracting initial stability metrics.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.MergeHistogram.{Type}
histogram.summary: Records which histograms were merged into the current log from external sources. {Type}

histogram.name: UMA.InitSequence
histogram.summary: Logged during MetricsService initialization whether the init task or the initial log timer completed first. The expectation is the vast majority of the time, the init task should complete first. If metrics show otherwise, then it may indicate there's a bug in the MetricsService init sequence and that it should be investigated.

histogram.name: UMA.IsClonedInstall
histogram.summary: This is logged with a value of true in every log when the UMA client code has detected that this is a potentially cloned install and has set the pref to reset its UMA client id on the next startup.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.DroppedHistogramSampleCount
histogram.summary: Number of histogram samples that were not recorded when flushing due to cache size limits in the Java in-memory cache. There are separate limits on the number of cached histograms, and the number of samples in a histogram.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.DroppedUserActionCount
histogram.summary: Number of user actions that were not recorded when flushing due to a cache size limit in Java the in-memory cache.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.FlushedHistogramCount
histogram.summary: Number of histograms recorded when flushing the Java in-memory cache.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.InputHistogramSampleCount
histogram.summary: Number of histogram samples seen by the time the Java in-memory cache was flushed. This includes samples counted in DroppedHistogramSampleCount.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.InputUserActionCount
histogram.summary: Number of user actions seen by the time the in-memory cache was flushed. This includes actions counted in DroppedUserActionCount.

histogram.name: UMA.LocalPersistentMemoryAllocator.Failures.Posix
histogram.summary: Failures, as reported in errno, encountered while allocating local persistent memory under Posix.

histogram.name: UMA.LocalPersistentMemoryAllocator.Failures.Win
histogram.summary: Failures, as reported by GetLastError(), encountered while allocating local persistent memory under Windows.

histogram.name: UMA.LogSize.OnSuccess
histogram.summary:
Size in kilobytes (after compression) of an uploaded UMA log. Recorded after a successful UMA upload.
Note: A related metric (UMA.ProtoCompressionRatio) logs the compression ratio.

histogram.name: UMA.LogUpload.Canceled.CellularConstraint
histogram.summary: Logs whether a log was not uploaded due to cellular log throttling logic. Android only.

histogram.name: UMA.LogUpload.ResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes and network errors encountered by UMA when attempting to upload logs to the server through an HTTPS connection.

histogram.name: UMA.LogUpload.ResponseOrErrorCode.HTTP
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes and network errors encountered by UMA when attempting to upload logs to the server through an HTTP connection.

histogram.name: UMA.LowEntropySource3Value
histogram.summary: Distribution of the new low entropy source value. Corresponds to metrics::prefs::kMetricsLowEntropySource. Used for field trial randomization. Recorded on startup.

histogram.name: UMA.LowEntropySourceValue
histogram.summary: Distribution of the old low entropy source value. Corresponds to metrics::prefs::kMetricsOldLowEntropySource. Used for field trial randomization on clients that already have it, but not created on new installs. Recorded on startup.

histogram.name: UMA.MachineIdState
histogram.summary: Tracks if the machine ID is generated successfully and if it changes from one run to the next. The machine ID is a 24-bit hash of machine characteristics. It is expected to change if an install of Chrome is copied to multiple machines. This check happens once per browser startup.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsIDsReset
histogram.summary:
Records when the metrics IDs (client id and low entry source) are reset due to a cloned install detection. This is done during startup when MetricsStateManager is created.
A cloned install is detected when the current machine ID (24-bit hash of machine characteristics) is different than the one stored in local state. A pref is then written to local state to indicate a clone. The metrics IDs are reset on the next startup assuming the cloned install pref is still set.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsReporting.Toggle
histogram.summary: Logged when user successfully enables/disables MetricsReporting or when an error occurs.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsService.Initialize
histogram.summary: Records true during the initialization of the metrics state, right at the time of logging a count to launch_count in stability prefs.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsService.Initialize.Time
histogram.summary:
Time taken by MetricsService::InitializeMetricsState().
Note that clients without high-resolution clocks will report 0 for very short times.

histogram.name: UMA.NegativeSamples.Histogram
histogram.summary: The lower 32 bits of the ID of the histogram that went negative.

histogram.name: UMA.NegativeSamples.Increment
histogram.summary: The amount of increment that caused a sample count to become negative.

histogram.name: UMA.NegativeSamples.Reason
histogram.summary: Reasons why a negative sample count would have been created. Currently, only negative samples from persistent sparse histograms are being checked.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentAllocator.{PersistentAllocatorType}.Errors
histogram.summary: Errors detected by the persistent memory allocator. These are set when they occur. {PersistentAllocatorType}

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentAllocator.{PersistentAllocatorType}.UsedPct
histogram.summary: Percentage of persistent memory segment that has been allocated. This is updated only once per reporting cycle. {PersistentAllocatorType}

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentHistograms.DriveType
histogram.summary: Records the drive type the persistent histograms file opened on start up is on. Only logged on Windows based on the result of the GetDriveTypeW() API. Added to diagnose crbug.com/1176977.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentHistograms.HistogramsInStartupFile
histogram.summary: Records which histograms were found initially in the .pma file used by the browser process for persistent histograms. The expectation is there should be no entries there, but this histogram is added to diagnose a problem we're seeing where this could be the cause. See crbug.com/1176977 for details.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentHistograms.InitResult
histogram.summary: A count of successes and failures for the creation of various forms of persistent memory used to store histograms.

histogram.name: UMA.PrimaryUserType
histogram.summary: This UMA logs the primary user type per metrics recording interval.

histogram.name: UMA.ProfileSignInStatus
histogram.summary:
WARNING: despite the name, this histogram is about *sync*, not sign-in.
An enum representing the sync status of all opened profiles during one UMA session.
Reported incorrect data on ChromeOS before M80. Removed from ChromeOS in M97.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoCompressionRatio
histogram.summary: Compression ratio of the serialized protobuf that will be uploaded to the UMA server. This serialized protobuf is compressed using gzip. See also UMA.LogSize.OnSuccess.

histogram.name: UMA.Pseudo.{Metrics}
histogram.summary: This is the pseudo {Metrics} metric. It's logged alongside with the real metric. The value of this pseudo metric is a linear function (ax + b) of the real value (x). The multiplicative factor (a) and additive factor (b) are controlled by field trial experiments. This metric is used for data validation and to help us better assess the accuracy and power of data from field trials.

histogram.name: UMA.ReadAndTruncateMetricsFromFile.DiscardedCount
histogram.summary: Number of metric samples discarded on each read from the ChromeOS external metrics file. This should only be greater than 0 if the file had so many samples we couldn't fit them all in memory. Emitted each time ReadAndTruncateMetricsFromFile() is called and successfully processes the external metrics file. No entry is emitted if there was an unexpected error opening the file. If the file is found to be corrupt partway through a read, the number of entries discarded before the corruption is found is recorded.

histogram.name: UMA.ReadAndTruncateMetricsFromFile.ReadCount
histogram.summary: Number of metric samples successfully read from the ChromeOS external metrics file on each read. Samples discarded because the file is too large are recorded in UMA.ReadAndTruncateMetricsFromFile.DiscardedCount and not in here. Emitted each time ReadAndTruncateMetricsFromFile() is called and successfully processes the external metrics file. No entry is emitted if there was an unexpected error opening the file. If the file is found to be corrupt partway through a read, the number of entries read before the corruption is found is recorded.

histogram.name: UMA.SamplingRatePerMille
histogram.summary:
Sample rate applied to this client, expressed as number of clients per 1000 that are in the sample. Recorded on every log upload but only if the client is eligible for sampling. (As of September 2019, the only clients eligible for sampling are Windows and Android installs on which the UMA checkbox was enabled by default.)
Clients not eligible for sampling will not have this histogram recorded.
Clients that are eligible for sampling but are sampled out (i.e., not uploading logs) will not have this histogram recorded. Notably, it will not appear in chrome://histograms! (Obviously, it also won't appear in the UMA logs because the client is not uploading logs.)
Additional nuance, hopefully not important: the rate refers to the session that the log was generated in, not the session the log was generated about. This means when UMA uploads information about the last session (such as stability statistics), it is possible--though extremely unlikely--that the sampling rate config has changed from the previous session to the current one. As such, the sampling rate emitted in a previous-session log record may not be the right one that should've applied to that record.

histogram.name: UMA.StructuredMetrics.ClientInitializationSuccessful
histogram.summary: Emitted on initialization of structured metrics client. Records whether the client was initialized successfully.

histogram.name: UMA.StructuredMetrics.EventRecordingState
histogram.summary: Emitted when a structured metrics event is sent for recording. This records whether that event was recorded successfully, or otherwise what error occurred.

histogram.name: UMA.StructuredMetrics.EventsRecordedUsingMojo
histogram.summary: Emitted each time a structured metric event is written. Records true if the mojo API was used.

histogram.name: UMA.StructuredMetrics.InternalError
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/08/2021. This histogram had a recording bug that grouped failed key errors with failed event errors. Prefer to use InternalError2.
histogram.summary: Records unexpected internal errors of the structured metrics system. The bucket proportion of this metric is not meaningful.

histogram.name: UMA.StructuredMetrics.InternalError2
histogram.summary: Records unexpected internal errors of the structured metrics system. The bucket proportion of this metric is not meaningful.

histogram.name: UMA.StructuredMetrics.KeyValidationState
histogram.summary: When a user event key is validated (and possibly updated), whether the key was valid and required no changes, missing and required creation, or old and required rotation.

histogram.name: UMA.StructuredMetrics.NumEventsInUpload
histogram.summary: How many events are provided when the structured metrics system is called on to provide its current session data.

histogram.name: UMA.StructuredMetrics.PrefReadError
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2021 as structured metrics now stores data in protos rather than prefs. Replaced with UMA.StructuredMetrics.InternalError2.
histogram.summary: When the structured metrics provider initializes, it reads the pref store from disk that holds keys and unsent logs. If there was an error during that read, this records the error code. PREF_READ_ERROR_NO_FILE is recorded whenever a particular profile signs into a particular device for the first time, so a reasonable number of errors are expected.

histogram.name: UMA.TruncatedEvents.Omnibox
histogram.summary: The number of omnibox events that existed in the metrics log before we truncated them to save bandwidth.

histogram.name: UMA.TruncatedEvents.UserAction
histogram.summary: The number of user actions events that existed in the metrics log before we truncated them to save bandwidth.

histogram.name: UMA.UnsentLogs.Dropped
histogram.summary: Counter for number of UMA unsent logs removed from persistent storage.

histogram.name: UMA.UnsentLogs.DroppedSize
histogram.summary: Size of unsent logs removed from persistent storage due to exceeding the individual log size limit. Unsent log trimming occurs immediately after initial logs creation, upon successful log upload, or whenever MetricsService stops recording.

histogram.name: UMA.UnsentLogs.PersistedSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size of all persistent initial or ongoing logs that have been proto-encoded and compressed in the previous browser run; it is recorded on the browser start up. The value '0' means no unsent logs.

histogram.name: UMA.UnsentLogs.SentCount
histogram.summary: The number of UMA sent samples in the previous browser run; it is recorded on the browser start up.

histogram.name: UMA.UnsentLogs.UnsentCount
histogram.summary: The number of UMA unsent samples in the previous browser run; it is recorded on the browser start up.

histogram.name: UMA.UnsentLogs.UnsentPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the unsent samples over the total in the previous browser run; it is recorded on the browser start up.

histogram.name: UMA.UserActionsCount
histogram.summary:
Emitted when a user action is recorded.
Intended to be used to estimate how many user actions are lost due lack of being persisted in the same way histograms are. One way to use this histogram is to look as the count in this histogram in logs that come from the previous session. All of those user actions will have been lost.
Also note that user actions can be lost due to being truncated before uploading a UMA record. Those logs user actions are recorded in the histogram UMA.TruncatedEvents.UserAction.
There may be other ways user actions are dropped too.

histogram.name: UMA.UserDemographics.IsNoisedAgeOver21Under85
histogram.summary: True indicates that the current user is over the age of 21 and under the age of 85 inclusive, and unknown otherwise. Specifically, this histogram can't identify users under 21 and over 85. The user's age includes a random offset for privacy. This metric is logged periodically through ProvideCurrentSessionData().

histogram.name: UMA.UserDemographics.Status
histogram.summary: The status of the retrieval of user demographics from sync that are reported to UMA. Emitted each time UMA metrics are reported.
